Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable hotel with 5-star amenities”
Reviews.Author: Erika B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so very clean, comfortable with beautiful decor and wonderful amenities -- the rooms are definitely smaller, but they are well designed and exceptionally well appointed. The breakfasts were lovely (and included), and the staff there was very nice. The only slight draw back for me was the location - it was very quiet (a plus) and it close to the Bastille metro (also good), and the area is well-regarded (near the opera house and Bastille monumnet). But because this is an area that draws more political activities, it tends to be a bit littered with trash, graffiti, etc. - it is sort of reminded me of the "Berkeley" of Paris - up scale but a a little rough around the edges. As a female traveling alone, this made it feel just a bit less safe - though I didn't have any specific threatening situations. But it's not quite the same as staying on a quaint Parisian street. All that said, I would definitely recommend the hotel - it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel, average service”
Reviews.Author: IL0veNature
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice for business. The area is not bad (close to the Bastille) with quite some restaurants to choose from. The rooms are comfortable enough (duvets, good choice of pillows) although a bit on the small side. The reception is ok, not overly friendly, but not less than in other Paris hotels. The decoration is nice. In the reception area there are different expositions every time. Sometimes painters, then photographers. There is a small bar service downstairs which is adequate but not great if you are looking for a cosy bar atmosphere. The breakfast is served in the same area and is very basic. The service is slow. There is basically one lady to serve everybody coffee and keep the buffet stocked, but she was not up to the task. Both times I was there, both of the days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat S
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night and because we booked it in advance we got great room and fantastic breakfast for less then 130 pounds, so for us it was value for money. Staff were speaking English and were very friendly. There were no troubles with leaving our luggage for several hours after check out. It was perfect Valentines Day!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the internet price paid”
Reviews.Author: J0hnGibbs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Marceau Bastille overnight on 9th January, while on a business trip. I was given a room street side on the 4th floor, which was well furnished/equipped and quiet. The bed was very comfortable and I got a good night's sleep in preparation for my working day ahead. At an internet price of €160 including breakfast through booking.com, it represented very good value in my opinion, for what was on offer. My only criticism, which is admittedly minor; the scrambled eggs and bacon that were on offer at the breakfast buffet looked and tasted as though they had been out on display for quite a while.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid-January 2012 and was given one of the rooms on the street side, on the sixth floor. I found it quiet and very light, with large windows in the bathroom as well as the bedroom. The room is a reasonable size by Paris standards, with a very comfortable bed, and very well-appointed and clean. I found the staff very helpful indeed, speaking good English, and friendly and courteous. The breakfast is good by French standards and the cheese offered really excellent. I would certainly recommend it and will stay there again. It is fairly convenient for central Paris being on good bus routes with a frequent service (minutes to the Left Bank for example) and between the metro stops at the Bastille and the Gare de Lyon, each a few minutes’ walk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, welcoming, efficient and well located”
Reviews.Author: Cath34980
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome by attentive staff, were shown to our room, our ipod dock didnt work, this was sorted immediately, nothing was a problem for them. The reception area on the ground floor with seductive lighting and a trickling water feature looked very inviting. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Practically lived there for a year”
Reviews.Author: KatBudapest
Reviews.Content: The Le Marceau (MB affectionately) has been my second home for almost a year (on a Monday - Thursday / Friday basis). Staying there so often and for so long allowed me to experience almost every room and to meet everyone from the staff. STAFF The staff is absolutely friendly and speaks excellent English (except for an older lady, Chantelle - but she is nice, too). They knew me pretty well, always arranged my favourite room (407 or 408), made sure my toiletries (and any luggage I left behind for the weekend) are brought up to my room before my arrival. ROOMS The most basic rooms (I stayed in these most time, these are the ones with the aubergine, magenta, dark grey color scheme) are very small, but have everything a business traveler should wish for. Clean bathroom, bathrobes, huge towels. The bathroom was always spotless - and this is a must (and something that unfortunately cannot be taken for granted in Paris). The duvet was nice and warm, the bed really comfortable. In every once in a while I got an upgrade (the beige, bamboo green and paded pink color schemed rooms) which are somewhat larger than the basic rooms. These were very nice and comfortable, too. BREAKFAST The buffet breakfast is to die for - baguette, croissant, pain au chocolate - you name it, a decent variety of cheeses (try the goat cheese, the chevre), smoked salmon, ham, eggs and sausages (warm food), very posh youghurt in many flavours, fruits (oranges, grapefruits), fruit salad, and freshly pressed orange juice / grapefruit, too. The coffe (Caffee Richard) is excellent, too. INTERNET / ROOM LOCATION There is a wireless internet available for free - the reception is significantly better on the street side of the building. However, the drawback of the streetside is that the grabage truck / laundry trucks seems to show up at usually late at night. When the laundry truck is there, and there is a car behind (or maybe more waiting) they usually horn to express their disapproval of the unwanted wait. So if you are looking for a quiet stay, opt for the courtyard rooms - the higher the better so you will see a beautiful sunrise over the Paris rooftops and lot of chimneys. FITNESS I tried it once but the equipment (1 threadmill, 1 step machine) seemed to be horribly outdated. Definitely not worth bringing the gym stuff. However, several colleagues of mine (avid runners) made nice long runs along the nearby Viaduc des Arts (which is a Promenade plantée on the top).

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: M H
Reviews.Content: As a global traveler, this is one of the very worst hotels that I have ever stayed in. Floors are dirty with cigarette burns on the carpet, beds are uncomfortable, no service to speak off, and the fitness center is a complete mis-representation of what the hotel is advertising as a "fitness" center. The fitness center consists of 3 old workout machines, in the room the size of a closet, down in the basement of the building. Further, the desks in the rooms were so small that I was unable to open my computer. Asked to check-out a few days early, and the hotel would not refund my money. Checked out early anyway...it was that bad. This is not a lovely boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMCJR
Reviews.Content: Marceu Bastille is a trendy boutique hotel recently renowed. All the areas are very well decorated in modern style (the big tap in the lobby with current water is relaxing!). The room was spacious with a big bed (not king size but almost), good facilities and well equiped. Breakfast is served near by the reception with good quality food. Certainly a good option while in Paris as it´s near by the public transportations and you can easily walk to some major atractions).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, blissful bed!”
Reviews.Author: Badger48
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a 2-day stopover en route to Florence. Staff were very welcoming. Room (standard double) was immaculate although wardrobe might be found a bit small for a protracted stay. Bed was a large double and extremely comfortable, air-con was quiet & effective. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and tasty. Before leaving home, we had emailed the hotel to ask if hairdriers were available in all rooms. On arrival, we found, not only the installed drier in the bathroom but an extra one in the bedroom. Also, after checking out, we were invited to use the gym facilities to freshen up before catching an overnight train. These are two examples of the attention to detail shown by the hotel staff. Would recommend this hotel for its proximity to Bastille area.

Reviews.Title: “the must of french quality”
Reviews.Author: lusogmx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this great hotel design in August, everything was perfect. The friendly and very helpful, great breakfast, comfortable bed, quiet room and clean. I finally found my second home in Paris. Bravo because the price is really attractive to the quality of their service. I really like it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice all around!”
Reviews.Author: labarista
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night on a business trip and the staff were wonderful. About 30 of us arrived at one time and they were well prepared to deal with the non-French speakers and get everyone sorted and up to their rooms. The rooms were VERY clean, well-decorated. I can't comment on value because I was not paying and do not how much the rooms were. Later on we had wine in the hotel lobby - fantastic service. In the morning I had a quick coffee and bite in the breakfast area before taking off and all was delicious. Check out was fast. Oh and after midnight the concierge was wonderful at helping us get a taxi to jet off to st. michel. I would definitely stay here again. It's just a few minutes to walk to Bastille, Quai de la Rapée or Gare de Lyon. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, well-managed hotel in a quiet street close to Bastille and Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: goabum
Reviews.Content: Parisian hotels are generally charmingly old-world, but that can be quite frustrating for the business traveler. Le Marceau Bastille is that rarity in Paris - a well-priced, well-located modern little gem and with excellent service to boot. It's a 5-minute walk from both the Gare de Lyon as well as the Place Bastille which is a hip, cool neighborhood with lots of nice restaurants and atmospheric bars. The staff were efficient, the room was well-appointed (and slightly larger than the Parisian tiny average room), the breakfast was good and the free wifi was fast. No view from the room, just a courtyard, but being off the street also meant it was super quiet. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “splendid !”
Reviews.Author: Laquint
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, rooms are clean and cozy. Personnel gentle and always available. very nice spot in the internal court for the breakfast, good food. I'll sure go back there if I go back to Paris. The location is very convenient for its proximity to Marais and the city centre both at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel on the Right Bank”
Reviews.Author: SJandKK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip with a large group and loved it! A great little boutique hotel with lots of character, great services and a wonderfully comfortable bed! Easily within walking distance of Notre Dame, great restaurants and good shopping. A few reviewers have commented on the lack of food etc. at breakfast or the poor quality of the breakfast... I thought it was completely fine - although perhaps we were up earlier as we were on a business trip. Would definitely stay here again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THiS hotel- will go back for sure”
Reviews.Author: razza80
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern, beautiful hotel. Excellent staff who speak English! Great service overall! Very happy with my stay there, definitely going to stay there again when in Paris. Also, excellent location with lots of restaurants and bars around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice nice decoration”
Reviews.Author: kokiton
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine, the room nice, great location and service only ok because don´t speak english or spanis (this is Paris!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markk612
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel that doubles as an art gallery. Very interesting modern decor, and a lobby with a great smell and atmosphere. The room itself was a little small (though I hear this is standard for Paris), but quite comfortable. Very comfortable beds with soft linens. Room always excellently cleaned. The location is a little out of the way of the main tourist attractions, though not horribly so, but the Place de la Bastille is about a ten minute walk away with a taxi queue and metro stop with connection to a number of lines. The neighborhood is not unsafe, but can be a little dark at night. The Place de la Bastille though is quite lively at all hours, and has a number of very good restaurants. Staff was helpful enough - depends on who is working the desk, but everyone is quite pleasant. The free internet is also an excellent plus. One complaint would be the breakfast. We thought it was free so didn't take it so hard when something would run out and wasn't refilled. When we learned on checkout that we had to pay for it (€24, not cheap), all the empty juices and lack of eggs or jams seemed quite unacceptable. If they want to charge for breakfast, it should be overflowing and well-stocked.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: Evangelia77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a greek agent office in a very good price (112 euro/night breakfast included) for paris' standards. The hotel is very clean in every part of it, it is in a quite street and you can really rest and enjoy your stay (small room but ok). The breakfast is nice with enough options but I wouldn't pay for it if it wasn't included. They don't refill it and after 8:30 you won't find some things. Staff was nice, spoke english and they kept our luggage for some hours cause he had a late flight. I cannot tell more about them because we never needed anything and we had prepaid the room. The location is nice, in the Bastille area where you can find many cafe,restaurants, shops etc 5 minutes walking distance from the metro station but quite far away from most important places in paris. I would prefer to stay somewhere closer. But for the money I paid , considering that Paris is really expensive and most hotels are dirty it was a fantastic choice. I really recomend it as long as you pay a reasonable price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury..without a wake up call!”
Reviews.Author: RestonVaDentist
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at the Hotel Marceau Bastille in the Bastille area of Paris on the Right Bank. It is a beautiful boutique hotel, near the Gare de Lyon on rue Jules Cesar. We loved the room, the hotel was very modern and art work was everywhere. But when we asked for a wake up call the morning we were to catch a train at 7:30 AM, we never got it! Fortunately, our son called us on our mobile phone. But a hotel of this calibre shouldn't make such a mistake!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to come home to”
Reviews.Author: BettyAn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights using points. I love how quiet and comfortable the hotel is. Considering this is Paris I don't find the room small at all. The free wifi is great - I love being able to chill in the room after a long day of shopping/sight seeing/eating/drinking and then relax in the hotel, eating chocolates in my bed and check emails and facebook. I travel a lot for work and stayed in the W hotels a lot all over the country, and I'd say this is similar to a good W in many ways - comfortable bed, comfortable cozy and modern room that's really clean, toiletry is good enough, and they emit this fantastic fragrance in the hallway so the air smells wonderful once you step into the hotel - also like the W! Great service as well - very very friendly and personable. Price is very reasonable for what you get. I stayed in the purple urban room on the fourth floor, facing the inner courtyard. For some hotels only the upgraded rooms are nice but I thought this basic room was quite decent. The only reason not to give it a 5 star, on the balance of things, is the location. The hotel is a good 5 to 10 minutes walk from the Bastille metro (which becomes painful when your feet is hurting from walking all day), and there seem to be just not a lot going on around there. The closest super market is 10 minutes walk the other direction from the metro (closer to Gare de Lyon). There's not a lot of good bakeries / restaurants close by. And then, it's in Bastille which is kind of far from the center of action. May be everything feels just far because it's freezing cold in December... Personally I like the locations of my previous hotels in the Vendome area and in St Germain - a little more central. However, if prime location is not the most important concern for you, then I'd highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh....”
Reviews.Author: bertzi
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people see in this hotel. The service is atrocious, the rooms are tiny and the breakfast is average at best. I have been to Paris many times and it is amazing, but the way we were treated at this hotel made us leave Paris with a bad feeling. E.g. First day we got there I asked the concierge if there are any especially good shows or exhibitions on. He said 'No'. Strange... (there were over 70 I found in one magazine I bought a few days later). After being refused certain basic requests, we spoke to the only on-site manager, who was at the front desk. He said "you can't talk to me now, I'm going home to sleep" - and off he went ! Strange...... Air con does not work in the rooms, the bathroom is a serious safety hazard and overall this hotel was the worst hotel of our honeymoon. Additional Warning - They don't replenish the breakfast, so if you have to stay there because everywhere else in Europe is booked out, get in early! We've stayed in 2 star hotels that are better than this. Ugh!

Reviews.Title: “A Tranquil Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Allison46
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner from 26/11/10 until 1/12/10. The hotel is lovely and I would definately recommend staying here. Our room was bought at Booking.com for half the price of the hotel recommended price, even though, we received lovely accomodation. We were on the first floor and one of the smaller rooms next to the lift but we never heard a sound from our room. At night we slept soundly even though our room faced the road. The room was great to get back to after visiting the busy centre of Paris as it was so peaceful and quiet. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to help us when our flight was delayed due to snow closing UK airports and we couldn't get home they suggested we book extra nights. Even though we told them we didn't have the funds to pay as we were not expecting the extra stay. They said it didn't matter and gave us the same low rate we had booked with Booking.com. It took a lot of the stress away to know we had a place to stay. Fortunately a relative paid the bill at the end of our stay. The breakfast is not usually included in the price and costs24 Euros extra. It is alot more than a breakfast that can be bought at one of the nearby local cafes at 8 Euros ( just coffee, orange juice, croissant, bread and jam) but the hotel breakfast is well worth it. They provide as much as you can eat in the price with cereals, juice, tea, coffee, ham, cheese, breads, pastries, jams and cooked breakfast of scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. We took this option and did not need to eat all day as we were full up. The hotel is very clean and modern with a no fuss decor. It almost feels like being in a home. I liked the sound of the fountain at reception that was very calming while drinking a cup of tea and looking at the art work in the seating area.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem and where I will stay next time”
Reviews.Author: vixiela
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a rental apt. in the Marais that turned out to be a nightmare. It was Fashion Week in Paris and finding a hotel was not easy. Finally we found a room here and moved. It is a small boutique hotel with every touch simply elegant. If the rooms were larger you would feel you were in a luxury hotel. The staff were lovely and the breakfast in the morning[included] was the best we had in Europe. I loved the location, much quieter than other neighborhoods but close to the river, and I feel that if one is near the river the location feels very central.

Reviews.Title: “Returned for 2nd Visit - Well, who wouldn't.”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidity060
Reviews.Content: Just as good as ever. Very hot weather in Paris for this visit, and the air conditioning in the room was just stonking! What a relief. The rates are not cheap, but there it is...lovely boutique hotel in central Paris. What can you expect.

Reviews.Title: “A top choice for Paris - clean, well located, with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: ED77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travelled a lot in Europe and have had our fair share of supposed 4 star hotels - this is the exception. Lovely design/gallery hotel with amazingly clean rooms, fantastic service at the front desk and well located to get around Paris. The rooms aren't massive, but that is to be expected in Europe in my opinion - however ours was perfectly comfortable for our purposes. Really comfy beds, and great to note that it had a strong, hot shower which can sometimes be elusive in Europe!! Free wifi is a definitely bonus - am typing this review whilst using it. Hasn't dropped out once with a strong consistent connection. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: CCKlyman
Reviews.Content: Located a short walk from the Gare de Lyon, and centrally located near the Place des Vosge, the Marais, Faubourg-St. Antoine and the Louvre, this little hotel is a gem. The rooms are spotlessly clean, modern and tastefully decorated. Bath is tiny but very functional. The staff is extremely helpful with cabs and restaurant suggestions. The only drawback is that the hotel is that the nearest metro stop is a little bit of a walk.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in Bastille, Paris”
Reviews.Author: ANK09
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel for nearly a year every week from Monday to Thursday. The hotel is always very clean and the staff very friendly it offers an excellent breakfast in the morning but can get pretty busy around 8am. Generally rooms to the back of the hotel on the higher floors are better in the hotel. The gym is really small so if you are staying to use this then don't even consider it. There is no air conditioning in the basement where the gym is and after about 10 mins in there you have to get out. There is free WI-FI in the hotel and available in all room which is nice. Recently the TV system is having issues so there are no english channels but on the whole it is an excellent hotel for it's location / price and would recommend it to people staying for a short time or a longer time like myself.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the week end”
Reviews.Author: dlerital
Reviews.Content: first thing to say is that this hotel is perfectly located when travelling to/from Gare de Lyon train station. great staff, very clean room and bathroom. well designed hotel. my only drawback is that the rooms are desperately small (Paris style) would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and charming hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Ombeline
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marceau Bastille Hotel in February for a couple of nights. Ideally situated 5 minutes away from the Place de la Bastille, it means you get good public transport (bus / metro) as well as great nightlife. The variety of pubs, restaurants and clubs around the Place de la Bastille is indeed wide, plus you obviously have the new opera house. Saying that, the hotel is situated just off the place, in a direction that has pretty much nothing interesting so your sleep won't get disturbed by noisy people staggering from one pub to another. As for the hotel itself, it is quite small and has few rooms but it's very clean and comfortable, with a generally modern/trendy theme to it. It also acts as a gallery, with paintings or photographs displayed (and for sale) in the bar / dining area. The staff was generally very helpful. When we came back from a restaurant at 1am and wanted a drink, the concierge opened the bar just for us. There are 3 types of rooms (Urban, which we stayed in, Ecolo - where the decoration has softer colour patterns, and Privilege - which is a larger Ecolo room). The room wasn't massive but well enough for a 2-night stay. There is free Wi-Fi (which I haven't used) throughout, and rooms have flat screen TVs, hairdryer, safe deposit box, mini-bar... Not the cheapest but you can get great promotional tarifs which make it very worthwhile for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 4 star hotel with a bit of character”
Reviews.Author: byrd_g
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this hotel on business in the Bastille area. This is my hotel of choice because it is neither bland or overly quirky. Nice touches are the regular art displays in the reception area and free WiFi - so many Parisien hotels want to charge a small fortune for this basic service and anything else they can pile onto your bill. One minor criticism, the breakfast buffet is generally good quality, but seating can get a little cramped at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel - would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: DiehlTX
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Marceau based on a recommendation from a French collegue and it was exceptional! The location was perfect and within walking distance of all activities in the Bastille area. The hotel was very clean, modern and chic. Beds were extremely comfortable and not at all like other hotels I have stayed at in Europe. The staff could not have been more accomodating and was very good natured with my less than stellar attempts to communicate in French (I am an American). True sophistication combined with a welcoming atmosphere make this hotel a unique find. I will definitely stay here again and recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: paencil
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Very clean , the staff were very friendly and helpfull and the location was good. Ask for a balcony room . These are on the sixth floor and it saw nice to have the doors open . Will return .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...enough said!”
Reviews.Author: giffypletts
Reviews.Content: Le Marceau Bastille is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It was excellent! I travelled to Paris for a week in February and stayed in this very modern and spotlessly clean hotel. The staff here were very friendly and greeted you every time you walked past the front desk, and nothing was too much trouble for them. All the fittings were contemporary and tidy (looked almost brand new).The room was cleaned daily and efficiently with fresh towels and toiletries in the bathroom. Breakfast is a simyple but very statisfying buffet. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to base yourself for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AshOxford_UK
Reviews.Content: We wanted to flaneur a bit, go shopping, eat well and this served us well as a base for the weekend. Convenient location, just down the metro line from Gare du Nord, on edge of Marais, 5 mins walk from Isle Saint Louis. We didn't spend much time in the hotel or even eat breakfast there but the room was very comfortable and immaculately clean. Front desk friendly and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and clean hotel in one of our favorite neighborhoods in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MimiJWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I'd been eyeing this hotel for several years, and we finally had the chance to spend couple of nights there last year. It's clean, stylish and on a quiet side street off the Rue de Lyon, just to the east of the Bastille and Rue St. Antoine, one of our favorite places for shopping. There are wonderful bakeries, clothing stores, shoe stores and cafés just around the corner. It's a short walk to Gare de Lyon and Gare d'Austerlitz (across the river). It is a short walk to the heart of Paris (Notre Dame, in my opinion) and the touristy areas, and it is also within easy access of the lovely Place de Vosges and the Musee Carnavalet on the Right Bank. The Champagne upon arrival and the Jean-Paul Hevin chocolates on your pillow are nice extras. Desk staff was friendly. Would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I wish we knew of a hotel like this in London.”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidity060
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marceau Bastille for one night on the way from London to Perpignan by rail. It was booked for us by Railbookers travel agency in London. The hotel has a modern art gallery attached, and there are a lot of modern paintings and prints scattered around. Hotel is very clean and bright and new. Room was very modern and well-appointed, although it was fairly small and the view was of the back of another building. We did not take dinner in the hotel, but we did have breakfast. In fact my teenage daughter would happily have spent her fortnight's holiday in the breakfast room, and was prepared to forget about Perpignan etc., all together. Finally, the location is very convenient for walking to most of the central sites etc., being very near the Seine and the Place de La Bastille and Notre Dame. We will stay here again. I just wish that we knew of an equally charming and convenient hotel in London. Since staying we have recommended it to friends who have also visited, and they were equally impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, wonderful honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: KitStrickland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights as part of our honeymoon. We stayed in the urban room. It was of adequate size and was clean. Our room faced the inside, so there was no off-street noise; however, as a result there was no view either. Everything was functional, staff was friendly enough (we aren't very talkative and didn't really ask for any extra services). The neighborhood is great. The Bastille is a more local area, so not crammed full of tourists or people. There were tons of shops and restaurants in the area, most open fairly late. There is an amazing pastry shop about 200 foot (60 meters) away, if you stay here make sure to try it. I would pay a ridiculous amount of money for one of those strawberry beignets right now! :D The Metro is also only a block or two away and will take you to anywhere you want to go in 20 minutes. My only minor complaints would be the strong fragrance in the lobby, the iPod docks not being compatible with 3GS iPhones (blame Apple for that), and the odd (to me) half shower door.

Reviews.Title: “Hyped up......”
Reviews.Author: BinaIsCool
Reviews.Content: I want to first of say the hotel is very trendy, and they made attempts to please us. However....the rooms are tiny, our sink smelled so badly of mildew, I could hardly sleep at night without the windows open. The hotel tried to remedy the issue, but alas, it still stank. We did not ask for another room, which they might very well have given us, but we were at the end of a three week trip and thus to tired for another move. The location is not too bad, but still a good 15 minutes away from Notre Dame or anything else remotely interesting. The neighborhood is safe enough, but street ruckus starts at 700am, which is a pain on vacation. My overall complaint would be that the hotel is vastly overpriced, so people I recommend the last minute booking deals.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and friendly”
Reviews.Author: harveyharvey
Reviews.Content: Staying in Paris for four nights we decided to go a bit upmarket this trip and chose Marceau Bastille from it's website. I am pleased to say it was a very good experience: the room was largish , well equipped and stylish, like the rest of the hotel. There is no restaurant but the breakfasts were good - freshly squeezed juices, fresh croissants and even bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs (these a bit dry). The location is excellent - Bastille metro station is on line 5 so it's a simple journey from Gar du Nord. Bastile also connects direct to Place Concord for all the very touristy bits. You are only a short walk from the Seine and Isle de St Louis.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siharris28
Reviews.Content: This was a very trendy hotel. Rooms were very clean and nicely done out, albeit a bit on the small side. Great location in the heart of Bastille, one of my favourite areas of Paris. Not much of a view from the rooms though. Friendly service from the front desk. fairly late check out allowed. Didn't bother with breakfast as very expensive. Highly recommend L'Ebauchoir bistro about 10 minutes walk away. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: carrom
Reviews.Content: We paid 180 euros per night for this hotel which is not cheap but certainly a lot different from the published rate of 350. For that price I would have expected a lot more. For 180 the hotel offers clean, stylish small rooms, a nice lobby, lots of amenities (slippers, bathrobes, minibar, safe...), pleasant staff and interesting decor. The street it's on is quite ugly and you need to walk 10 minutes to reach the charming Marais district . The Bastille Metro is 5 minutes away. I would stay there again if I needed to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and clean hotel, pleasant staff - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: worker_bea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights here and loved it! We arrived soaking wet - no make that dripping wet! - after a walk from Gare d'Austerlitz. The lady and younger man behind the desk were very polite and overlooked what we did to their lobby! They gave us coffee and a table while we waited for our room. Once we settled in, two glasses of sparkling wine were delivered. Our room was clean and chic, and the bathroom was pristine! The mini-fridge was well stocked and reasonably priced. The bed was comfortable. The room was small, but not as small as some, and the space was well utilized. It was fairly quiet, too, even though it was on the first floor in the front. The breakfast was pricier than some, but not the highest we've paid either. The staff is very polite, professional and helpful. The location was perfect - roughly midway between the Gare de Lyon and the Bastille, and within a short walk of the Rue St. Antoine, Place des Vosges, and the Village St, Paul, some of our favorite locations in Paris. Oh, and the bakery on the corner, open weekdays only, is fabulous (there are many other bakeries, cheese shops and a honey shop or two nearby). There is also a pharmacy on the other corner. There are two fine restaurants, Quincy and Au Biche a la Bois within three blocks. The Asian place next door was intriguing. There are a host of wonderful boutique hotels in this area, and this is one of them! I am not well-heeled enough to consider this a value hotel, but I will return when I feel the need to splurge. My husband and I were very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “Issues with Reservations”
Reviews.Author: ParisAugust2008
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its location to the Gare du Lyon (very close and a precise 5 minute easy walk) and because it looked nicer than the other local hotels. I reserved three rooms via email and received confirmations back. When all 6 of us arrived on a very busy Paris Saturday afternoon, the non-English speaking desk clerks said they only had 2 rooms reserved for us. They didn't care at all about our issue. Sorry, but no additional room. They ended up calling to a 2 star hotel down the street where I stayed with my husband. A very bad end to a lovely vacation in France. I cannot recommend this hotel due to the reservation mix-up and the front desk "who cares" response. I emailed them on my return about this issue and have not yet received a response. Not great service. Rooms are TIny Tiny and apart from being close to Gare du Lyon its not a great location in Paris (deserted at night apart from rough looking folks). Breakfast wonderful though in the am. Sunday am -- all set up by 7 a.m. promptly. Best coffee in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, brilliant, and unique!!”
Reviews.Author: LB47
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel for us for any future trips to Paris. It was recommended by a French friend who has worked in Paris previously and he had stayed at Le Marceau Bastille earlier this year while on a business trip. He was right. The rooms were lovely, and SO clean. The breakfast was superb, but don't try the pastries, they are addictive, they melt in the mouth and then you have to have one every day!! The choice at breakfast was amazing, I did write down everything that was on offer but I had a whole page of notes, suffice it to say that there were cereals, fruit juice, breads, cheese, cold meat, cooked items, smoked salmon, scrambled egg, fresh and dried fruit, and fabulous coffee!! I know I will have missed something out, there was such a choice. Perhaps here I should deal with the criticisms of the hotel that I have seen on Tripadvisor so far. The walk from Gare de Lyon was a few minutes, not a problem at all and, as I'm sixty one this year, I reserve the right to be critical of that comment! Someone also said that the beds were small, well I'm a mere five feet ten and my partner is six feet five and the bed was big enough for us, as was the bedroom. I think there was also a criticism made about the hotel being too far away from everything but it was a short walk to the footbridge across the marina and then you are in the 4th! The situation is superb, quiet and safe, but within easy reach of everything. We walked to Ile St Louis most days, it's just across the footbridge then left over the next bridge across the Seine, what could be easier? As for compliments for the hotel, there are many! When we first arrived we got to our room and had hardly been there five minutes when there was a knock at the door and we received a glass of champagne each, wonderful start to the holiday! The staff were superb, impeccably dressed and really helpful, even giving me the details of the florist they use, (there are flowers on the table, around the hotel, in each bedroom and they are stunning!) Their English was good (my French is not!) and there appeared to be an eagerness to get everything right for their guests, what more can you ask? The bedrooms were lovely, we chose 'Urban" we liked the stronger colours, the air conditioning was superb but we had a balcony and french windows too. The dining room had a variety of seating options, we tried them all, and the gallery had an "installation" as well as pictures and a sculpture in the patio area adjoining the dining room. We didn't want to leave and we can't wait to go back! All in all, we would recommend Le Marceau Bastille whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but location wasn't prime.”
Reviews.Author: smotravel
Reviews.Content: Overall liked the hotel itself. Nicely decorated, good size, nice staff and good quality rooms. Main drawbacks, as others have mentioned, are the lack of English speaking staff and certainly the location. It's a very short walk from the subway, but not too close to any main interest points of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: LeFlaneur
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend, nice hotel whose staff could use more training. Sadly, France seems incapable of creating a truly stylish, trendy boutique hotel a la NYC or London, and unfortunately le MB comes closs to its website but isn't quite there (picture no conditioner in the bathrooms, soap in little plastic-wrap, scratchy toilet paper etc and you get the idea--minor things that in truly great boutiques are all perfect). The bed was very comfortable and location great for those who want to explore this part of Paris. For those who think Paris begins and ends in St Germain, think again--Le Marais, Oberkampf, Republique, Bastille--this is where truly trendy Paris lies. Our one, major complaint about this hotel was housekeeping. On Sunday morning, jetlagged and looking forward to the one morning of the week to get a bit of sleep, we were promptly awakened at 7:30 am by the cleaners, seemingly dropping every item of furniture in the room above us, then proceeding to go room-by-room very loudly moving everything around, vacuuming, etc loud enough to ensure we didn't get a shot at sleeping in. During the week this would not be an issue but on a Sunday morning seemed a bit excessive--and good hotels train their cleaners to do their jobs without sounding like a herd of elephants. Of course at 11:30 the noise stopped as they then no doubt broke for coffee/lunch/siesta, while we were groggy and grumpy and not about to fall back asleep. So if the hotel trained their cleaning staff better, I would be inclined to stay here again. Oh, but skip breakfast--at 20 euros/person it's a ripoff when you can go to a great cafe around the corner and get a better meal with better people-watching for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “modern and friendly hotel, but Bastille is a little off the map”
Reviews.Author: lebarcelona
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Like the pictures on the website, it is very clean and modern, but still charming and colorful. The lobby is very nice and hip, and there's cool modern art on the walls, but we didn't spend much time there. Usually it was pretty deserted. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice-good colors and cozy but maybe a bit cramped; we had one with two single beds, and they were pushed together and a bit low. Not much of a view, because our window overlooked a small courtyard, but still it was nice. The only downside was the location. I had chosen the hotel based on the hotel itself, unaware that Bastille is a metro-ride away from most of the places we went to see. Don't get me wrong, Bastille is a very nice and charming district, just not as lively as other parts of Paris. I probably wouldn't stay here another time for that reason. But, for some of you, this might be a plus because at night, it's not too noisy at all outside. I'm a type of person who likes to hear sounds of the city. best part: atmosphere worst part: location

Reviews.Title: “super weekend spot”
Reviews.Author: LimerickOlly
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be refreshingly modern without being over the top. The staff were extremely friendly from the moment we arrived, offering us a glass of champagne as a welcome. The room was 'ecole', bright, well appointed and a reasonable size for Paris hotels in this price range. The bathroom was small but ecofriendly and had all the toiletries you will need.The bed is very comfortable but if you are very tall it might be a bit short! Internet is free. Breakfast is included in the price and excellent, available until 11 each day. We would definitely revisit here as it is central and a very friendly and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. This boutique hotel located on a quiet side street near the Bastille of Paris. You are an easy to walk to many things, but the hotel is not in the middle of anything special. The Bastille area is OK, with many lower tier restaurants and young people at night. Service throughout our stay was top notch. Numerous requests were handled effortlessly by the staff who all spoke good English. Probably one of the best I've reviewed. The hotel is trendy, modern, clean lines, fantastic color scheme. Check-in was effortless and shortly after arrival a knock at the door and 2 flutes of champagne were delivered. A very nice touch. The standard rooms are quite small and face the street (little to no noise). They work well for a weekend visit or if you are alone, but opt for a large room for a longer stay. Rooms are quite colorful and well appointed. Bedding was comfortable. Bathrooms nicely equippped, brightly illuminated. A slight negative for the cheap towels. Breakfast was included in our rate and the breakfast was a tad disappointing. A little disorganized. The breakfast area is too small for the size property. If breakfast is in your rate, fine, otherwise, there are bakeries in the nearby area. As denoted, internet access is free. Overall a great stay, a nice weekend romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien!!!!”
Reviews.Author: salstars
Reviews.Content: The Marceau Bastille was everything we had hoped for and more. The hotel and our room were very clean - I don't usually have a bath in hotel bathrooms but had no hesitation in doing so in our room. The staff were all very attentive and friendly. We were shown to our room and then were pleasantly surprised to be given a glass of champagne each, which arrived about 10 mins after we'd arrived. The windows were doubleglazed and the room had aircon, so although there is a busy road quite close by, we weren't disturbed by the noise at all. On Saturday night the innocuous looking restaurant next door turned into a teen-drinking fest complete with drunken kids stood on the pavement outside with a shopping trolley. After about midnight though, we didn't hear a thing. We booked through www.booking.com and got breakfast included in the price (and perhaps the champagne? We don't know!). Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel - convenient for the Marais, the Seine and close to the Metro at La Place de la Bastille.

Reviews.Title: “Where not to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DoranDoran
Reviews.Content: This trip was unusual for me since it was planned by someone else as a surprise trip to Paris. I therefore basically didn't plan the journey or have any say in the choice of hotel, room etc. The Hotel is very poorly located to the main tourist attractions in central Paris, lying about 750 metres South of the Bastille Square. This does mean it is in fairly quiet location but our trip also coincided with one of the very regular transport strikes in Paris so we had to wait nearly 90 minutes at Gare du Nord railway station for a taxi to the hotel which at about 4km is too far to walk. The buses were also impossible with baggage and completely collapsed, probably also due to the transport strike. Despite all these obstacles, I had a great time in Paris and I arrived at the hotel Marceaux de Bastille looking forward to a weekend break. The hotel is extremely new. I would guess no more than 12 months old. The reception area, which also doubles as a breakfast room is lined with modern art which is changed every 4 to 6 months and appears bright and attractive. The only seating in this area are low "bedroom" type chairs around small low circular tables. This area is also part of the breakfast room seating so if you coincide with a lot of guests on the same schedule, for example on a weekend you will amost inevitably be sat very low with your knees in front of you trying to eat breakfast. For young fit types this may be very cool but for your average chubby American tourist to Paris, this will be impossible to perform. To be fair, there are some "normal" height tables and also a large "stool height" table for 6 persons. The overall choice at breakfast is excellent (the croissants are to die for) and there is also a cheese trolley which is of a very high standard. The breakfast room opens onto a small glazed courtyard so it is a very pleasant room. I imagine that in good weather this becomes an open area which must be very nice indeed. However this area is the only PUBLIC area in the hotel. So no sofas, no lounge, no bar to sit in for a drink with friends. All this despite the very extensive ground floor floor space. It seems a bit nuts that you can only walk into reception and go to your room. The white minimalistic lobby is not softened at night with ambient lighting so although I guess you could order a drink you would not want to sit around in reception with friends. Onto the rooms, alas all is not well. Beautifully decorated, slim plasma tvs, safe, these rooms "tick all the boxes" except one SPACE. Our room was 107 however there was a fire exit plan to scale on the back of the door so on paper at least none of them are very big on the first floor at least. Putting it bluntly when in your room and not in bed, on the toilet or in the bath there is no space to do anything except stand. A space of around 40cm separates the bed from all the walls and furniture so, despite the pale and trendy decor there is NO ROOM to do anything except sleep. The hotel management were also very "french" when we raised these issues, NON I could not change room to a double bedroom, all were taken (this despite a 3 night stay), NON it was impossible to get the room tv to recieve the channels that were not in French (all non French channels were blacked out), they could of course leave a message for Mr Technician but this was not their fault etc etc. On our last day we ordered a taxi for 10am and this waited for ages in reception (which we assumed was normal given the strikes) only for one of us to walk outside to find that the taxi had arrived 10 minutes ago and was sat outside with the meter running (to the tune of 15 euros) which OUI I had to pay for. They did send two glasses of champagne up to the room on arrival which was a very nice touch. My partner used the fitness room which was also very limited in size and facilities consisting of one bike, one step machine and one bench. Period. Overall impressions STAY AWAY this hotel has nothing (except the croissants) to recommend it or make it unique or woth the visit. It's poorly located, not particularly well run and unfortunately the space and layout of the rooms make it a very bad value for money hotel. Our stay with breakfast was 600 euros for 3 nights so hardly a bargain either. If you a travelling to Paris and hear about a strike my recommendation would simply be to cancel and travel some other time. The city has far too few taxis and is too extensive to make walking a serious option over several days. From my trip, I would recommend chosing a hotel on the Rive Gauche, in the St Germain area where we eat, shopped and played for nearly the entire time. Given its distance from everything and the lack of restaurants in the same street (the nearest one is about 200 m away), its surprising that the management have not tried to increase food and beverage sales inside the hotel. Final vedict STAY AWAY unless you are on business in the Bastille or Gare de Lyon area, a dwarf on a diet and staying one night!

Reviews.Title: “welcome with style”
Reviews.Author: fatbird55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a side street within a stones throw of the Bastille. It's urban chic is carried right through the building, from the loos downstairs to the fittings in the bathrooms. The staff are efficient and welcoming, and deal quickly with any problems. The TV in our room wasn't working, and when they couldn't fix it, they moved us to another room without question. Breakfast was excellent, a really good spread, and again, helpful and efficient staff. The chocolates on the bed to welcome you are delicious too!

Reviews.Title: “More Than Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: roland00
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights (Sept 12 through 17) at the Marceau Bastille and was more than satisfied. It's worth the money if you're interested in a place you look forward to returning to after a long day of sight seeing or night out. Room size is just a tad bit larger than Europen standards though they've honed in on those things that make a stay comfortable...overall cleanliness, cozy bed, bright bathroom, more than adequate storage space, flat screen, shut out drapes and, if you're interested in this kinda thing, crisp modern styling. The staff was also more than helpful. The hotel location is on a small quiet street in an area where "true" Parisians live and work...yet is walking distance from Quartier Latin/Les Iles, Marais and other touristy areas. There is also a metro station within a 5 to 7 minute walk. More importantly, I felt safe here...considering it was my first time in Paris, was traveling solo and could speak only very limited French. Though staff is present 24/7, the front doors are secured late at night and one can only gain access after being cleared by the person at the front desk. I plan to return to Paris early next year and will be staying here again. Besides, it's a relatively new hotel and it shows it still. ro Dallas, TX USA PS--Check out the bakery at the end of the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: franklin07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Marceau Bastille for our anniversary mainly due to the reviews on TripAdvisor, the look/photos from their own website and location. It did not disappoint at all. Here are some key points: • Very short walk to the Bastille metro station which connects to pretty much everything you'd probably like to visit within 1 connection if not directly. This exact area does not have a great deal of activity (which was actually really nice) but you are a short walk away from a lot. We never felt unsafe walking to our hotel at any hour of the day. • Interior decoration/design is very up to date/modern and what you'd expect with a boutique-style hotel. Our view wasn't much but rooftops, but we had a picturesque sunrise just about every morning. • This isn't the cheapest hotel, nor is it the most expensive. The lengthy research I did on hotels really led me to believe this was the one of the best values for the money. • Rooms are indeed very small (even smaller than I expected), although I read most all hotels are in Paris. We managed to work with the space given and the positives outweighed this negative. Bed/pillows were very comfortable and the bathroom seemed very new and functional. We had free internet wi-fi as well. • Service was great. Staff did speak enough english to help us out when needed and we very friendly. Chocolates were left every night on our bed. We regretfully did not use the dining area downstairs but it did seems nice. Other general notes about Paris: Check out the restaurant Tarmac which is right up the street from this hotel. This was the one of the best meals food-wise I had in Paris. As you'll probably read elsewhere, beware of pickpocketers. We saw a lady get her purse stolen at the Louvre. Stay away from the gypsies that ask if you speak english or the ones who act like they found you're ring on the ground (this was very creative though). These people tend to hang out at the touristy spots, the Eiffel Tower, bridges, etc. Weren't big fans of Versailles. Our expectations may have been too high. The place is indeed gourgeous, massive and amazing. The directional signage, the ticketing process, and the massive crowds really ruined this day trip. If I were to go again, I would just stick to the outdoor gardens (which were amazing) and not do the inside tours unless you are dying to see the hall of mirrors. If you are looking to save money here and there, be sure to shop the supermarkets. We bought some cheese and wine (which was great and very affordable), stopped and bought a baguette, and had a great afternoon snack. The lady at front desk of the hotel was very helpful and had the bottle of wine opened for us as well as giving us 2 wine glasses. Another day we stopped and bought orange juice and some chocolate pastries and sat on a bench in a garden for breakfast. You will spend a lot of money on meals on the trip so a few money-savers along the way can still be fun. Bring great walking shoes (but stylish of course) and a good pocket map. We did a lot of walking on this trip and saw so many cool things becuase of it. It is easy to get turned around in this city, but having the maps obviouslly helped out immensely. We also used Google Maps quite a bit before and while there to determine where to go and how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: WernerZ
Reviews.Content: We picked the Marceau Bastille because of the location near the Gare de Lyon where we arrived from, departed from, and made a few trips to EuroDisney from. The hotel is 3-4 blocks from the train station, in a nice part of Paris. We were able to walk to Notre Dame, and other places from the hotel. The hotel rooms were quite nice and stylish. We had adjoining rooms for the 5 of us (3 kids), which is not always easy to get. Considering we were in Paris, the triple was a nice sized room. The bathrooms were very nice and clean. The only gripe I have about the rooms is that while the carpets were vacuum cleaned daily, our white socks got quite dirty. We are used to taking shoes off in our house, and not have them get that dirty. The breakfast was excellent (nice cafe au lait). The staff was pretty helpful (above avg for Paris!). The Japanese restaurant near the hotel was good, well-priced, and had a very nice waitress who spoke English well, and was able to assist us in ordering non-standard sushi menu items. All in all, we had an excellent stay in Paris, thanks to the Marceau Bastille hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and peacful haven, away from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: naomijax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Bastille Metro station, which being on 3 different lines is handy for most tourist sites. It is also about 7 mins walk to the Gare du Lyon, which has a direct RER link to Versailles. All-in-all the location suited us well. We walked home from the Jardin du Tuileries on one evening, this took us approximately 35 minutes, but was a pleasant walk along the Rue de Rivoli and the Marais. The hotel itself is nicely decorated. We stayed in an urban room, decorated in pink and purple, with a flat screen television. I was surprised at the size of the bedroom and bathroom- they are both much smaller than rooms I have stayed in previously. However the style, cleanliness, and comfort (with the air conditioning) of the rooms more than made up for this. Two glasses of champagne brought to our room on arrival was a nice, and unexpected, touch. The buffet breakfast is nice and there was always plenty of everything available. The staff were helpful- but did not speak much English, this did not bother me as it gave me a chance to actually use that French learnt in school! I would probably stay in this hotel again on a trip to Paris. However, only if I managed to find a cheap deal at E175 per night including breakfast as I think the rackrate of E300 is too much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, modern hotel away from the traffic and the tourists”
Reviews.Author: AllonsEU
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a clean and - above all - quiet hotel with an up-to-date bathroom and facilities, for a relaxing few days in Paris. Having done some careful research on the Internet, the hotel's web site, Google maps and satellite (you can make out the actual hotel and the courtyard referred to below), I thought the Marceau Bastille suited our specifications and booked, specifically requesting a quiet room. On arrival, we could not have been more pleased with our choice of hotel, or the room selected by the staff for our stay. Our room was at the rear of the hotel, high up and overlooking the enclosed but airy courtyard, and we could not hear any traffic or other noises to disturb our sleep, even with the windows open. The room also had effective air conditioning, if we needed to cool off after a hard day's sightseeing. We didn't even hear another guest's door shut until the 3rd night. The bathroom was spotless, and the bath/shower combination produced plenty of hot water. The cupboards, drawers and under the bed/desk were clean with no evidence of the lint or dust that seems to accumulate in other hotels we have stayed in. The staff were very helpful and pleasant, delivering a glass of Champagne to our room within 15 minutes of check-in and the inclusive breakfasts were fresh and varied, with little treats like strawberries and raspberries. The only critisism I could make is that the dining tables are too small, so the self-service buffet involved lots of to-and-froing to collect items and the careful arrangement of used crockery - rather like an in-flight meal - before being cleared away by the attentive waiter. I've had to stay in plenty of quality chain hotels during my business travels. The rooms in the Marceau Bastille are of a similar standard and price, if a little small, but the hotel comes without the impersonal service and bland decor. As other reviewers have pointed out, the hotel is not in some buzzing locality - it's in a district where real Parisians live and work. I kind of enjoyed the quiet walk from the Bastille, at the end of a long day hitting the tourist hot spots. It felt like coming home, stopping at the small grocery shops where we could stock up on a bottle of water or some fruit for less than a Euro. In summary, the hotel does exactly what it says on the tin, and very competently too. If you think every hotel in Paris has a view overlooking the Eiffel Tower, don't stay here. On the other hand, if you want something quiet, clean and refined, which is convenient for the tourist must-sees, but provides an oasis of calm, the Marceau Bastille is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Bastille”
Reviews.Author: Design-Family
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to Paris frequently for the past fifteen years, as often as two or three times per year. For a long time we stayed at Hotel d'Aubusson (St. Germain) but it is often booked, and we are often looking for a great design hotel in Paris which is good value (ie. not necessarily cheap, but one that lives up to expectations). We tried to book the Marceau Bastille in February but it was sold out; luckily, we were able to snag an 'Urban' room at a great rate for this past weekend. The hotel is fantastic, and that is the first time I've been able to say that about a Paris property in some time. I would not say that this hotel is for those who are not accustomed to Paris or the whims of the hotels there. It is not in the more classic tourist locations (read: mass tourism). It is on a simple street in the Bastille, steps from a charming footbridge with direct access to the Marais. Like all Parisian hotels the rooms are compact, but thoughtfully laid out and oh-so-comfortable. The design is fantastic for those of us that appreciate modern design - if you are not a fan, you will characterize it as too stark (we loved it, along with the art in the gallery!). Some just prefer chintz and faux Parisian decor - tant pis, their loss. The staff is incredible professional and accommodating - this is a 'real' hotel with someone manning the desk, real air conditioning, flat screens, free wifi, a gorgeous bathroom, dead silent rooms, a small fitness center, etc. ... all in all, a place we will most definitely return to. The best feature - truly the most splendid breakfast I have ever seen in a Parisian hotel. The breakfast room is gorgeous, the service beyond reproach - and everything is completely fresh ... a large selection of artisinal cheeses, fresh fruits of every variety (peeled grapefruit segments?!!!!), yummy yogurts, breads, etc.. I never leave my room before breakfast in a French hotel (love that room service), but this was worth moving for! So, if you're a frequent Paris traveler, want a hotel in a great location sans that swarming tourists, need all the amenities and you appreciate great design and service - look no further! Enjoy! We did!

Reviews.Title: “Sterile and not in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnt
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by the Marceau Bastille. Whilst the photos are accurate and it is modern and clean, it lacks any character or atmosphere. It's in a quiet, ugly street, only five minutes from the Bastille, but a good 10-15 minutes from the interesting part of the Marais. The receptions "gallery" area is like a morgue and not somewhere you'd want to spend time or even sit and have a quick drink. The staff, whilst not unhelpful, we not particularly warm of friendly. We paid for a "superior" rooom and the bathroom was big, however, the towels were small and not remotely fluffy. It's fine if you are looking for a simple, clean hotel, but there is nothing special about it. Wish we'd stayed at the Petit Moulin which appears to have far more character.

Reviews.Title: “Charmless Hotel on a Charmless Street”
Reviews.Author: urbanvelo
Reviews.Content: We had booked here for three days, and upon arrival my boyfriend, quite rightly, got into a very bad mood. The hotel is clean, and we had a very good experience with the conceirge, who made restaurant reservations for us after i emailed her. But beyond that it was kind of a bust. The decor is modern, but drab drab drab. The loungey music in the lobby is overbearing, and the staff at the front desk were amateurish to say the least. We paid extra for a "privelege" room, and boy was it hard to see what the priveleges were. To say that it is in the Bastille is technically correct, but the "happening" part of the Bastille is a pretty long hike -- about a half hour walk to the Rue Oberkampf, for example. And the hotel is across the street from some hideous 60s apartment block (or maybe its an office building) -- the street has no charm, and very little Parisian feel. We decamped after one night to the left bank, and were much, much happier. I'm more than a little puzzled by the very high ratings here on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Sound bet”
Reviews.Author: Gerry0
Reviews.Content: Firstly, Bastille is a good part of Paris to stay regardless. Good restaurants, bars and transport links with a very young feel to the place. Choose your timing carefully and you might even get a mini riot like we did (because of election result). The second best thing about Le Marcelle Bastille is the customer service - nothing was too much trouble and their English is far better than our French. Although the bedroom (and the rest of the hotel) is decorated in a contemporary and artful style, it still doesnt disguise the fact that the room we stayed in was very cramped. You can pay a lot less for similar sized hotels, less the design. I would therefore recommend as a safe hotel to stay in; great location; good service but dont expect a lot of room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Crosbie
Reviews.Content: I went to paris for 4 days with my girlfriend and was extremely happy with this hotel. I chose it because it got such a good review from Tripadvisor, and it's easy to see why. The first thing that you notice when you go in is the aroma in the air. It is a very modern, very clean hotel. The rooms are well decorated and the beds are very comfortable. The staff are quite friendly and willing to give advice. I booked through HotelsRUs.com and got around 20 to 30 Euros off the normal price. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from 2 of the main Metro stations, Gare de Lyon and Bastille. Bastille will take you to Garde de Nord (connects by RER to Charles de Gaulle), and also directly to Champs Elysees (all the main attractions). Gare de Lyon will take you to EuroDisney (if you want to go there). There are also some nice restaurants nearby. Only negative points I can think of is that I specified double room and got a twin, I asked for a paracetamol for my girlfriend after we were rained upon in EuroDisney and was told they were not allowed to give it (seems extreme), and because my girlfriend was sick on the final morning of our stay, I asked for a late checkout, which would have resulted in 15 euros for 2 hours. I think all of these negative points are acceptable considering it's the hotel has limited rooms and need to stay in business. So, if you want to pay around 160 euro for a really good modern hotel in Paris, then definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel will change your view of paris”
Reviews.Author: aubiac
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. For years we have tried to find a reasonable priced and modern hotel without the normal flocked wall paper and mirrors so beloved of paris . Marceau is just perfect and a great location , near the canal and within easy walking distance of Richared lenoir market and the marais. The staff were so helpful even managed to keep from us that we had a bottle of champagne in our room sent by a friend from England. The breakfast was so good we needed just falafel for lunch from the street stall in the Marais. I would always try to stay here but make sure you book well in advance because they seem to be complet most weekends. A great place wonderful rooms and comforttable bed and lighting. Julie and Tony London

Reviews.Title: “Cool calm and collected - a great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: The England Family
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent modern hotel, recently renovated, which is immaculately clean and uncluttered, slightly to the east of the centre of Paris. The nearest tube station - Quai de la Rapee has direct connections to Gare du Nord, Gare de L'Est and Austerlitz. It was a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame along the river. It's in a quiet uneventful street and that made the hotel also a haven of peace in an otherwise busy city. Check in was smooth and efficient and friendly, our room was spacious enough for a two night stay, well furnished, comfortable bed, decent bathroom. Breakfast was very good, buffet style, and it meant we didn't really need lunch. We booked a deal which included breakfast with Priceline, but if you have to pay for it, it's a rather hefty 20 Euros (we paid not much more that that for a very good 4 course dinner at La Biche au Bois restaurant nearby). Overall this is an excellent hotel, very clean (and had good airconditioning, which we needed as it was 27 degrees C (80F) when we were there). It was slightly out of the hub of Touristy Paris - that can be a good thing or not, depending on why you're there. What I particularly liked about it is that it concentrated on the things that matter (comfort, efficient staff, good hearty breakfast) and ignored things that don't matter (like useless ornaments and clutter and fake grandiosity) this led to a cool, clear, 'unfussy' hotel that I will certainly return to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ArmadilloLondon
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in more mediocre Paris hotels than we care to remember we were very happy with this one. Excellent location on side street street 5 mins south from Bastille and very close to the Marais. Helpful staff. Decor plain, stylish in shades of purple and white. Very fussy about bed and pillows as the latter particularly is often found wanting. Not here; extremely comfortable bed and pillows and added bonus of duvet - relatively rare in French hotels. Bathroom plain and white, very clean with knockout power shower. Only drawback was the noise in the street, climaxing in a cheerful but prolonged delivery of laundry opposite at around 3am! So would suggest asking for a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterfly12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently for a long weekend. Very convenient to the Metro. Restaurants close to hand also. The hotel, bedrooms and ensuite were modern, bright and clean. Breakfast was good. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish and new”
Reviews.Author: Spindlelady
Reviews.Content: Tried this as a result of tripadvisor recommendations and was not disappointed. This is a comfortable hotel, nicely decorated and in pristine condition. The rooms and bathrooms are big enough for a shortish stay and were very well maintained in terms of cleanliness. We were on the 6th floor with 2 large windows overlooking the courtyard. This offered a bright and airy feel to the room, as well as quiet. There is a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro stations; Bastille and Gard de Lyon equidistant. Hotel provides breakfast at 20 Euros each but there are so many cafes within a few minutes walk that this does not offer good value, especially if one prefers to save oneself for lunch. A plethora of cafes and restaurants nearby in virtually every direction. The Marais, the Latin Quarter and Jardin des Plants and the Islands are easily accessible from here on foot. Easy metro access to most other key tourist areas. The staff are courteous and helpful. The Bar area is modern with vivid art work on display and atmospheric soundtrack offering a trendy and feelgood ambience. I recommend it warmly and would certainly return. However, it is probably a bit distant from the very centre of the city for a first timer, yet the rate is significantly more competitive to similar standard of hotels in the hub of things.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, very nice, good value”
Reviews.Author: Trion
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while travelling on business. Had a meeting at Gare de Lyon, so was very convenient. Also very close to Bastille. Room was nice, very modern, and reasonably spacious for Paris. Bathroom/Shower are great, very modern bathroom, particularly the shower. Didn't have breakfast, and in fact spent less than 12 hours in the hotel, but it was exactly what I needed, and good value at the rate. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahamed0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 3 day paris break. It is a cool, modern hotel in a great location (right near Bastille Metro and a short walk form the Marais). The rooms beautifully decorated and finished to a high standard as well as being a good size for Paris. The staff were great and it is little touches like bringing us a complimentary glass of champagne on arrival that were the icing on the cake. I'd highly recommed the place to anyone (we booked with railbookers who were also polite, efficient and great value).

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Kikouz
Reviews.Content: I think almost everthing about this hotel had been said. It's true that it's a lovely, modern, clean and stylish hotel. What was not being said: - The breakfast is 20€ pp - There is a gym center but with only three cardio machines and a flat screen. Very small thus. The personnal is very convenient. For instance, my bedroom was ok but the big bed was with actually two matteress putting together instead of one big one. I kindly asked if I can have another room and they quickly propose one to me. This second was even a bit bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juno82
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel, friendly attentive staff, nice ambiance, close to loads of stuff and a couple of metro stations. Try and check out the market at bastille on a sunday morning, amazing. The rooms were a little small but very clean and nicely finished with a graet balcony and a view over the paris roof tops. Nice bar/restraunt round the corner called the china club , very cool and relaxed grest cocktails and smooth bar staff. Enjoy it

HotelInfo.Name: Le Marceau Bastille Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 13 Rue Jules Cesar, 75012 Paris, France
